original_solution_mapping.L1: Todd has $25 left after buying ingredients because 100 - 75 = <<100-75=25>>25
original_solution_mapping.L2: Todd made $150 selling snow-cones because 200 x .75 = <<200*.75=150>>150
original_solution_mapping.L3: Todd has $175 before he pays his brother back because 25 + 150 = <<25+150=175>>175
original_solution_mapping.L4: After Todd pays his brother back he has $65 because 175 - 110 = <<175-110=65>>65

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5794.
    Returns: the amount of money Todd has after paying back his brother.
    """
    # L1
    borrowed_amount = 100 # borrowed $100
    ingredient_cost = 75 # spent $75 on ingredients
    money_after_ingredients = borrowed_amount - ingredient_cost

    # L2
    num_snow_cones_sold = 200 # sells 200 of them
    price_per_snow_cone = 0.75 # for $.75 each
    money_from_sales = num_snow_cones_sold * price_per_snow_cone

    # L3
    total_money_before_repayment = money_after_ingredients + money_from_sales

    # L4
    repayment_amount = 110 # repay him $110
    final_money = total_money_before_repayment - repayment_amount

    # FA
    answer = final_money
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Todd has ${money_after_ingredients} left after buying ingredients because {borrowed_amount} - {ingredient_cost} = <<{borrowed_amount}-{ingredient_cost}={money_after_ingredients}>>{money_after_ingredients}
Todd made ${money_from_sales} selling snow-cones because {num_snow_cones_sold} x {price_per_snow_cone} = <<{num_snow_cones_sold}*{price_per_snow_cone}={money_from_sales}>>{money_from_sales}

Todd has ${total_money_before_repayment} before he pays his brother back because {money_after_ingredients} + {money_from_sales} = <<{money_after_ingredients}+{money_from_sales}={total_money_before_repayment}>>{total_money_before_repayment}
After Todd pays his brother back he has ${final_money} because {total_money_before_repayment} - {repayment_amount} = <<{total_money_before_repayment}-{repayment_amount}={final_money}>>{final_money}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Todd has $25 left after buying ingredients because 100 - 75 = <<100-75=25>>25
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Todd made $20000 selling snow-cones because 200 x 100 = <<200*100=20000>>20000
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Todd has $20025 before he pays his brother back because 25 + 20000 = <<25+20000=20025>>20025
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: After Todd pays his brother back he has $19915 because 20025 - 110 = <<20025-110=19915>>19915

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'borrowed_amount' (100) was used instead of 'price_per_snow_cone' (0.75).
